questions.question: How many annual leaves can I carry forward?
questions.answer: Employees may carry forward up to 30 days of earned leave into the next calendar year, subject to manager approval.

questions.question: Can I take a personal day off without using my casual leave?
questions.answer: Yes, one personal day is permitted per calendar year without deducting from your casual leave balance, subject to manager approval.

questions.question: Are part-time employees eligible for company benefits?
questions.answer: Part-time employees working at least 20 hours per week for 6 months are eligible for prorated benefits, including health insurance and training reimbursements.

questions.question: What is the employee referral bonus policy?
questions.answer: When you refer a candidate who completes 3 months of employment, you receive a referral bonus of ₹15,000, subject to tax and managerial approval.

questions.question: How do I apply for a training reimbursement?
questions.answer: Submit a reimbursement request via the HR portal with the course receipt and approval letter before starting the training. The company reimburses up to 50% of fees after successful completion.

questions.question: What are the minimum password requirements?
questions.answer: Passwords must be at least 12 characters long, include uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and a special character. Passwords expire every 90 days.

questions.question: Can I use my personal mobile device for work emails?
questions.answer: Yes, only if your device is enrolled in the company’s Mobile Device Management (MDM) system and meets encryption and remote-wipe standards.

questions.question: How often should I update my antivirus software?
questions.answer: Antivirus software must be updated at least once per week, and full system scans must be scheduled monthly.

questions.question: What should I do if I lose my company laptop?
questions.answer: Immediately report the loss to the IT security team, change all passwords, and enable remote wipe if supported. A replacement will be arranged after incident review.

questions.question: Is employee biometric data collected?
questions.answer: Yes, biometric data (such as fingerprint scans) may be collected for access control. Use of this data is governed by the company’s biometric and privacy policy.

questions.question: Can I request deletion of my personal data?
questions.answer: You may request data deletion by submitting a data-erasure request. If data is required for compliance or statutory purposes, it will be anonymized instead.

questions.question: How long are CCTV recordings retained?
questions.answer: CCTV footage is retained for 30 days for security purposes and then automatically overwritten unless required for investigation.

questions.question: Is GST included in reimbursement claims?
questions.answer: Yes. GST can be claimed if the original receipt shows valid GST registration and it is within policy limits.

questions.question: Are international roaming charges reimbursed?
questions.answer: Only business-related roaming charges from corporate travel are reimbursed, subject to manager approval and corporate cap limits.

questions.question: What is the procedure for petty cash claims?
questions.answer: Employees may submit petty-cash requests up to ₹5,000 using the petty-cash voucher form. All expenses must be certified by a manager and backed by receipts.

questions.question: How are bonus payouts calculated?
questions.answer: Bonus payouts are based on individual performance rating and company eligibility criteria, and are paid within 45 days after the year-end audit.
